com.baypackets.ase.sbb
Interface B2bSessionController

All Superinterfaces:
SBB
public interface B2bSessionController
extends SBB

The back-to-back session controller interface (B2bSessionController) defines an object that is used to establish and control a back-to-back user agent session.

Author:
BayPackets

Method Detail

dialOut

public void dialOut(javax.servlet.sip.Address address)
 throws ConnectException,
 java.lang.IllegalStateException,
 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
This method is invoked to establish a back-to-back user agent session between two network endpoints. This method requires that the other party of this call is already connected and has been added to the SBB. 

 This method sends out an INVITE to the address specified.
 When it receives a provisional response or 2xx final response from the above address,
 it sends out a re-INVITE to the other party that is already connected.
 When it receives the 2xx final response for the re-INVITE from the other party,
 It sends ACK to both the parties involved and sets up the Call.
 If everything goes well, it notifies the application that call is CONNECTED else FAILED.

Parameters:
address - - The address of the endpoint to dial out to.
Throws:
ConnectException - if an error occurs while dialing out to the specified party.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this B2bSessionController object is currently managing an existing session between two endpoints or if it was explicitly invalidated or if the other party is NULL or not connected yet.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given Address is null.

dialOut

public void dialOut(javax.servlet.sip.Address partyA,
 javax.servlet.sip.Address partyB)
 throws ConnectException,
 java.lang.IllegalStateException,
 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
This overloaded version of the "dialOut" method handles all aspects of connecting the two specified parties. 

 In this case, the SBB does the following,
 a. Sends OUT an INVITE message to Party A.
 b. When it receives a 2xx response with SDP, it sends INVITE to Party B.
 c. When it receives 200 from Party B, the SBB sends an ACK to Party A with Party B's SDP.
 d. It also sends ACK to Party B.
 e. Notifies the application with a CONNECTED event.
 f. In case of any failure, the SBB handles the SIP transactions and notifies
 application with a CONNECT_FAILED event.

Parameters:
partyA - - The address of Party A.
partyB - - The address of Party B.
Throws:
ConnectException - if an error occurs while connecting the two parties.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this object is already managing an existing back-to-back session or if it was explicitly invalidated.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the given Address objects is null.

connect

public void connect(javax.servlet.sip.SipServletRequest request,
 javax.servlet.sip.Address address)
 throws ConnectException,
 java.lang.IllegalStateException,
 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
This method connects the originating endpoint and the terminating endpoint (and its address object), that were specified by the given request, into a back-to-back user agent session.

When an initial INVITE request is received by a Servlet from Party A, the Servlet then creates an instance of a B2bSessionController object and invokes this method passing it the given request object and the address of the terminating endpoint, Party B.

The B2BSessionController takes care of the subsequent SIP messages between both parties and notifies the application whether the call is CONNECTED or FAILED. If any MessageModifier object is associated with this object, it will be invoked by this method to perform any header and/or body manipulations to the outbound request before it is sent to the terminating endpoint.

The following example demonstrates the usage of this method in a Servlet: 

 
// The Servlet's "doRequest" method...
public void doRequest(SipServletRequest request) {
// Create the Address of the terminating endpoint to connect.
SipFactory factory = (SipFactory)this.getServletContext().getAttribute(SIP_FACTORY);
Address address = factory.createAddress(...);
// Create a B2bSessionController object and connect the two // endpoints... B2bSessionController b2b = SBBFactory.getInstance().getB2bSessionController();
b2b.connect(request, address);
...
}

Parameters:
request - - A SIP INVITE request specifying the originating network endpoint to connect.
address - - The address of the terminating endpoint to connect. If this is null, the request URI in the given request object is used as the terminating address.
Throws:
ConnectException - if an error occurs while connecting the two endpoints.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there are any endpoints still being managed by this object or if this object was explicitly invalidated.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given Address parameter is null or the specified request is not an INVITE request.

connect

public void connect(javax.servlet.sip.SipServletRequest request,
 javax.servlet.sip.Address address,
 javax.servlet.sip.Address from)
 throws ConnectException,
 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
This overloaded version of the "connect" method takes an additional "from" Address argument which will be used as the "from" address of the outgoing SIP INVITE request generated by this method.

Throws:
ConnectException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

disconnectA

public void disconnectA()
 throws DisconnectException,
 java.lang.IllegalStateException
This method disconnects the Party A endpoint from the back-to-back user agent session. This will initiate a BYE transaction with Party A. Typically, all the endpoints should be put on mute before this method is invoked by calling "mute()".

Throws:
DisconnectException - if an error occurs while disconnecting the specified endpoint.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no Party A is currently connected or if this object was explicitly invalidated.

disconnectB

public void disconnectB()
 throws DisconnectException,
 java.lang.IllegalStateException
This method disconnects the Party B endpoint from the back-to-back session. This will initiate a BYE transaction with Party B. Typically, all the endpoints should be put on mute before this method is invoked by calling "mute()".

Throws:
DisconnectException - if an error occurs while disconnecting the specified endpoint.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no Party B is currently connected or if this object was explicitly invalidated.

disconnect

public void disconnect()
 throws DisconnectException,
 java.lang.IllegalStateException
This method disconnects both endpoints from the back-to-back session. This will initiate a BYE transaction with both parties. Typically, all endpoints should be put on mute before this method is invoked by calling "mute()".

Throws:
DisconnectException - if an error occurs while disconnecting the specified endpoint.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no party is currently connected or if this object was explicitly invalidated.

muteA

public void muteA()
 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
This method mutes the Party A endpoint. Calling this method sends a re-INVITE or UPDATE request to Party A with an SDP specifying that no further media should be sent to the Party B endpoint. Party A can subsequently be un-muted by calling "unMuteA". This method would typically be called before disconnecting the Party B endpoint from this back-to-back user agent session.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no Party A is currently connected or if this object was explicitly invalidated.

muteB

public void muteB()
 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
This method mutes the Party B endpoint. Calling this method sends a re-INVITE request to Party B with an SDP specifying that no further media be sent to the Party A endpoint. Party B can subsequently be un-muted by calling "unMuteB". This method would typically be called before disconnecting the Party A endpoint from this back-to-back user agent session.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no Party B is currently connected.

mute

public void mute()
 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
This method puts all the parties handled by this SBB on MUTE.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this object was already invalidated or if no call parties are currently being managed by this object.

unMuteA

public void unMuteA()
 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
This method un-mutes Party A. Calling this method sends a re-INVITE request to Party A with an SDP indicating that media sent from Party A to B can resume.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no Party A is currently connected.

unMuteB

public void unMuteB()
This method un-mutes Party B. Calling this method sends a re-INVITE request to Party B with an SDP indicating that media sent from Party B to A can resume.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no Party B is currently connected.

resync

public void resync()
 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
This method exchanges the SDP messages between the parties involved in the SBB, using the method defined by the behavioral attribute "MUTE_METHOD". If any of the party is already muted, this operation would un-mute that party.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this object was already invalidated or if no call parties are currently being managed by this object.

isAOnMute

public boolean isAOnMute()
 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
This method indicates whether the Party A endpoint is currently on MUTE or not.

Returns:
"true" if Party B is on MUTE or "false" otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this object was explicitly invalidated or if no call parties are currently being managed by this object.

isBOnMute

public boolean isBOnMute()
 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
This method indicates whether the Party B endpoint is currently on MUTE or not.

Returns:
"true" if Party B is on MUTE or "false" otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this object was explicitly invalidated or if no call parties are currently being managed by this object.

cancelConnect

public void cancelConnect()
This method cancels the ongoing CONNECT operation. If the application has called any of the connect() methods, and it has not yet received any event (CONNECTED or CONNECT_FAILED), then calling this method would cancel the current CONNECT operation. If there are no connect operation is in-progresss, this method would simply return.

cancelDialout

public void cancelDialout()
This method cancels the ongoing DIALOUT operation. If the application has called any of the dialOut methods, and it has not yet received any event (CONNECTED or CONNECT_FAILED), then calling this method would cancel the current DIALOUT operation. If there are no dialOut operation is in-progresss, this method would simply return.
